intro: Hieracium poliochloroides, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers consist of yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk. Hieracium poliochloroides is often considered a weed due to its rapid spread and ability to colonize various habitats.
